title: Chhattisgarh to set up traditional medicine board | Raipur News - Times of India
author: TNN; Nov
description: Chhattisgarh government announced to establish a Traditional Medicine Board to conserve local medicinal herbs and promote practice of Ayurvedic treatm
cleaned_text: establish a Traditional [Medicine Board](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/medicine-board) to conserve local medicinal herbs and promote practice of [Ayurvedic treatments](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/ayurvedic-treatments) in Chhattisgarh. As per officials, chief minister Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday announced to establish a Traditional Medicine Board, in a state-level traditional vaidya sammelan-cum-training program at Pt Jawaharlal Memorial Medical College. The Vaidya Sammelan aimed to address the research and development of herbal medicines which could be extracted from jungles of Bastar and across Chhattisgarh. The event was organised under the aegis of Chhattisgarh State Planning Commission, State Drug Plant Board, Small Forest Produce Association and Forest Department. Chief minister said that Chhattisgarh is endowed with richness in three Ms - music, medicine and metallurgy. There is a variety of rich tradition of music and folk dance from Surguja to Bastar. In addition, metallurgical evidence has been found in Sirpur. The chief minister asserted to encourage the practice of [naturopathy](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/naturopathy) treatments offered by 'vaidya', who are engaged in this profession since generations. Forest minister Mohammad Akbar also said that steps should be taken to preserve the forest wealth and conserve the age old herbal treatments by documentation. The ministers assured to provide a platform for vaidyas to secure their age-old treatments with herbs and ensure the profit for villagers, who sell forest grown herbs in traditional markets. Baghel said the medicinal board will segregate the categorise vaidyas as per their specialisation in treating a particular disease.
